intro: Pancratium telanganense, commonly known as the Telangana yellow nutmeg, is a flowering plant native to the Indian state of Telangana. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a yellow, fleshy fruit that contains a single seed, which is used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry deciduous forests and open grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
